def stock_market():
    
    import requests

    import bs4

    import pandas as pd

    global search, price
    
    icp=float(input('Enter the upper price: '))
    check_price = icp
    while check_price == icp:
        
        search='DOGE-INR' #you can change stock/crypto code
        #search = input("Type any company's name of which Stock Price you want to search: ")

        search_url = f'https://in.finance.yahoo.com/quote/{search}?p={search}'
        
        search_results = requests.get(search_url)
       
        soup = bs4.BeautifulSoup(search_results.text, 'html.parser')
        
        data_array = soup.find('div', {'class': 'D(ib) Mend(20px)'})
       
        price = data_array.find("span").text
        price = price.replace(',', '')
        price = float(price)
    
        if price >= check_price: #if True, it will call gmail_alert()
            
            gmail_alert()

            check_price = price #it will break the while loop and end the program


def mail_alert():
    
	import smtplib
	from email.mime.multipart import MIMEMultipart
	from email.mime.text import MIMEText

	mail_content = f'hey,{search} is at {price}'

	# The mail addresses and password
	sender_address = 'username@gmail.com' #your gmail id
    
	sender_pass = '16-digit password' #use below link to get you 16-digit password
    #https://support.google.com/mail/answer/185833?hl=en
    
	receiver_address = 'username@gmail.com' 
    #use same as sender_address to get notification on your device
	
    # Setup the MIME
	message = MIMEMultipart()
	message['From'] = sender_address
	message['To'] = receiver_address
	message['Subject'] = f'DOGECOIN_PRICE @ {price} update'  # The subject line change accordingly
    
	# The body and the attachments for the mail
	message.attach(MIMEText(mail_content, 'plain'))

	# Create SMTP session for sending the mail
	session = smtplib.SMTP('smtp.gmail.com', 587)  # use gmail with port
    
	session.starttls()  # enable security
    
	session.login(sender_address, sender_pass)  # login with mail_id and password
	text = message.as_string()
	session.sendmail(sender_address, receiver_address, text)
	session.quit()
    
	print('Mail Sent')
	#Congratulations, you are done


if __name__ == "__main__":
	stock_market()
